fields.value: Census of Population and Housing, 1980:  American Indian Supplementary Questionnaire Public Use Microdata Sample

authorName.value: United States Department of Commerce. Bureau of the Census

authorAffiliation.value: United States Department of Commerce. Bureau of the Census

dsDescriptionValue.value: The 1980 American Indian supplementary file provides information on the American Indian, Eskimo, and Aleut populations beyond that obtained from the regular 1980 census questionnaire. The questionnaire was used on all federal and state reservations and in the historic areas of Oklahoma (excluding urbanized areas) to obtain information about the unique living conditions present on many reservations and in those specified areas of Oklahoma. Population items from the supplementary questionnaire include: tribal affiliation, educational attainment, health services received, occupation, work history, benefits received, and income. Housing items include: source of water, source of heat, kitchen facilities, telephone, electrical lighting, and materials and age of structure.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR I.A.1.c. Census Enumerations: Historical and Contemporary Population Characteristics, United States, Decennial Censuses, 1980 Census
NACDA I. Demographic Characteristics of Older Adults

fields.value: Version Date: 1992-02-16Version Text: 1992-02-16 Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: LRECL;Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: The file comprises two types of records: housing and persons. Data are recorded for 12,949 households and 50,265 persons with a total of 63,214 records in the file. Subsample numbers have been assigned to each case so that subsamples of various sizes may be drawn from the data set. The data contain alphabetic and blank codes.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: Data file(s), and electronic documentation.;

distributorName.value: Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research

distributorAffiliation.value: Institute for Social Research, University of Michigan

value: All persons living in households with one or more American Indians, Eskimos, or Aleuts on reservations identified for the 1980 Census and in historic areas of Oklahoma (excluding urbanized areas).

fields.value: Five out of every six housing units on reservations or in   historic areas of Oklahoma that received a short census form were   included in the original supplementary questionnaire sample. A   stratified systematic procedure with probability proportional to the   sample weight of the householder was used to select this ten-percent   public use microdata sample. The sampling elements were the occupied  housing units including all occupants.
